page.title: 05HAILES CHURCH (Today)
page.content: Much of the Norman church still survives.In the 13th century some magnificent wall paintings were added to the church.They include pictures of Saints Catherine,Margaret and Christopher;mythical beasts such as the griffon and the unicorn;and herldic panels.At the Reformation the paintings were covered over,and the Altar was replaced by a Communion Table placed in the centre of the church.Under Chrles 1 it was moved to the East end.The wall paintings were uncovered and restored in 1970.
